title: How to Make Chocolate Hazelnut Cheesecake

steps.headline: Make the crust and preheat the oven.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 350 degrees F (176 C). Place 1 cup (85 g) of graham cracker crumbs, ⅓ cup (50 g) of ground hazelnuts and ¼ cup (50 g) of packed light brown sugar into a food processor. Blitz the mixture to combine the ingredients. Pour in ¼ cup (55 g) of melted unsalted butter and ½ teaspoon of vanilla extract. Blitz the mixture to incorporate the butter. Since the graham crackers and hazelnuts are already ground, you won't need to process the crust mixture very much. The food processor just helps combine the crust quickly.

steps.headline: Press the crust into the pan and bake it.
steps.description: Grease or spray a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan with cooking spray. Dump the crust mixture into the bottom of the pan and use your fingers to firmly press it into the pan. Bake the crust for 7 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove it and let it cool while you make the cheesecake filling. You could also use the bottom of a glass or measuring cup to press the crumb crust into the pan.

steps.headline: Make a ganache and adjust the oven temperature.
steps.description: Turn the oven down to 325 degrees F (162 C). To make the ganache, place 6 ounces (170 g) of chopped semisweet chocolate into a mixing bowl. Pour 2 cups (473 ml) of heavy whipping cream into a small saucepan. Turn the heat on to medium, so the cream just begins to bubble a little. Remove the cream from heat and pour it over the semisweet chocolate. Whisk the ganache until it's smooth. Put it aside while you make the rest of the filling. You should whisk the ganache slowly, so the hot cream doesn't splash you.

steps.headline: Beat the cream cheese with the sugar.
steps.description: Let 1 pound (453 g) of cream cheese set out at room temperature until it's soft. Place it in a mixing bowl and use an electric hand or stand mixer to beat the cream cheese. Scrape the sides occasionally, so all of the cream cheese becomes fluffy. Slowly beat in ¾ cup (150 g) of sugar. If the cream cheese is cold, it will be difficult to beat and the cream cheese won't become light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the cornstarch, hazelnut liqueur, and eggs.
steps.description: Sprinkle in 1 tablespoon of cornstarch and add ½ cup (120 ml) of hazelnut liqueur to the cream cheese mixture. Beat the mixture until the liquid is combined. Add 2 large eggs, but beat them in one at a time on low speed. The cream cheese filling should now appear runny. It will thicken a little as you stir in the ganache.

steps.headline: Combine the ganache and the cheesecake filling.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to pour the ganache into the cheesecake filling. Beat the ingredients on low speed for about 30 seconds, so the chocolate is evenly distributed throughout the filling. If you prefer, you could stir the ganache in by hand. You may need to stir it longer to ensure that it's well combined.

steps.headline: Spread the filling in the crust and bake the cheesecake.
steps.description: Pour the chocolate hazelnut filling into the prepared crust and bake it for 30 minutes. Leave the oven door closed and just turn off the oven. Leave the cheesecake in the oven for 30 more minutes. The cheesecake will finish cooking as it sits in the cooling oven. Avoid opening the oven door or the cheesecake may not set up properly.

steps.headline: Serve the chocolate hazelnut cheesecake.
steps.description: Take the cheesecake out of the oven and let it cool on a rack until it's at room temperature. Cover the cheesecake with plastic wrap and refrigerate it overnight. When you're ready to serve the cheesecake, gently remove the outside band from the springform pan, so you can easily slice the cheesecake. You can garnish the cheesecake with cocoa powder and whole, toasted and peeled hazelnuts.

steps.headline: Make the crust.
steps.description: Place 10 tablespoons (140 g) of unsalted butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. While the butter melts, you can crush 1 10.6 ounce (300 g) package of digestive biscuits in a food processor until they're crumbs. Pour the melted butter into the crumbs and put the lid on the food processor. Blitz the mixture until the butter is incorporated. If you can't find digestive biscuits, you can use graham crackers. You may need to break up the sheets of graham crackers, so they fit in the food processor.

steps.headline: Form and chill the crust.
steps.description: Get out a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan with a removable bottom. Dump the buttery crumbs into the pan and spread them evenly. Use your fingers to press the crust firmly into the bottom of the pan. Put the pan in the fridge to chill. If you don't want to use your hands to press the crust, you can use the bottom of a glass or measuring cup.

steps.headline: Beat the cream cheese and powdered sugar.
steps.description: Let 18 ounces (500 g) of cream cheese come to room temperature. It should be completely soft. Place it into a large mixing bowl along with 2/3 cup (85 g) of powdered sugar. Use a hand or stand mixer to beat the cream cheese and powdered sugar on low speed. Once the sugar is incorporated, you can turn the speed to high and beat the mixture, so the cream cheese becomes fluffy. If you try to beat the cream cheese while it's still cold, the cheesecake filling will be lumpy.

steps.headline: Whip the heavy whipping cream with vanilla.
steps.description: Pour 1 1/4 cup (300 ml) of heavy whipping cream cream into a large mixing bowl along with 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Use electric mixer to whisk the cream on high speed for a few minutes, so soft peaks form in the cream. If you can, chill the mixing bowl and whisk attachments for about 15 minutes before you want to whip the cream. This will help the cream whip up faster.

steps.headline: Fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to spoon the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture. Gently fold the whipped cream into the mixture, so it's completely incorporated. Avoid stirring in the whipped cream or you'll lose the volume. To fold, hold the spatula and use a twisting motion with your wrist, so the whipped cream is gently combined with the cream cheese.

steps.headline: Chop the hazelnut chocolates and stir them into the filling.
steps.description: Unwrap 15 hazelnut chocolates and use a sharp knife to carefully chop them into rough pieces. Set aside about two-thirds of the chopped chocolates to use for the garnish. Scoop the remaining third into the bowl with the cream cheese filling and gently stir the chocolates in. You can use hazelnut chocolates like Ferrero Rocher or even just chocolate covered hazelnuts.

steps.headline: Spread the filling in the crust and chill the cheesecake.
steps.description: Use the rubber spatula to pour and spread the filling over the crust in your springform pan. Spread the top, so the filling is even. Cover the cheesecake with plastic wrap and put it in the refrigerator to chill for at least 6 hours. If you want to make the cheesecake ahead of time, you can make it a day in advance and chill it overnight.

steps.headline: Drizzle the cheesecake with melted chocolate hazelnut spread.
steps.description: Measure 4 tablespoons of chocolate hazelnut spread into a small saucepan. Turn the heat on low so the spread melts within a few minutes. It should become runny. Turn the heat off and let the chocolate cool a little. Drizzle it over the cheesecake and chill the cheesecake until you're ready to serve it. You can also sprinkle the remaining chopped hazelnut chocolates over the cheesecake as a garnish.
